intro: Eranthemum nigritianum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety foliage and clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom throughout the year under suitable conditions.
